citations.narrative:
The three doors leading from the den area to the outside portion of the enclosure are cut out of a metal wall. This wall
shows signs of decay with numerous rusty holes. The edges of all three doorways are jagged and rusty. This can lead to
pain or injury as the bears brush up against these edges when entering or exiting the den. The indoor and outdoor
housing facilities shall be structurally sound and shall be maintained in good repair to protect the animals from injury and
to contain the animals. To be corrected by March 7, 2022.
This is a 1st Relicense Inspection for a Class “C” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
Applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by April 8, 2022 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Relicense Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
End Section
